cold_snaps.status: No active cold snap is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: No active heatwave is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Ranked 8th for rainfall today's storm had precipitation totalling 13.04mm, falling at 8.6mm per hour at times during the 7.9 hour long storm.  On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 27.64mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 15.9 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A rapid deluge happened today when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour (ranked top in our records).  The storm lasted 2.0 hours and 7.99mm of precipitation fell during that time.

storm.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024 when 24.56mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 6.4mm per hour.
Storm conditions are present now.  It is the first storm in the region since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 9 days and counting so far started on 26 August 2025 and ranks 5th in length since records started in August 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (205°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 77.6 miles.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.2 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1604 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 14.3m lower than yesterday, 501.4m lower than the past week, 1604.2m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 713m minimum and 1594m maximum, with an average of 1052.6m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1554.0m and 2660m.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; the temperature will feel pleasantly warm. Also, oppressively muggy and sticky and little or no wind. Periods of rain anticipated, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and periods of sunshine are expected. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
